reviewText: Powerful testimony!!!

Love this short video about the testimony of Anita Keagy and how to seek God first.  I highly recommend it for the whole family to watch and to learn how to have joy in reading God's Word.  Written b: Mary SW

I thought this was a drama, but it's a stand-up testimony.  I usually HATE those.  Anita Keagy is just wonderful in her delivery of this message - I really didn't feel preached at at all.  I found myself watching to find out what finally happened.  She's blunt about all the choices she had when she got pregnant, why she decided what she did, and how that played out in her life.  This is more like a radio program on video - simple and not much to it, but worth a listen all the same.
That wasn't what I expected at all but I am so glad I watched it to the end.

This really blessed me in so many ways from how lovingly her parents responded to her pregnancy to all that the Lord showed her about Him and how He feels.  It was not what I expected but it was what I needed.  I thought it was a short movie but I'm so glad that I watched this testimony.

This is not a movie...it's just religious anti-abortion propaganda and a woman telling a story about herself being pregnant and choosing to have the kid. It shouldn't even be listed with regular movies, and should be more forthright about what it is. Thank goodness I didn't pay to watch it! Not recommended unless you are in the mood for preaching.
superb testimony.  God bless you and your family, Anita

I thought it was beautiful. I understood her message loud and clear.
Well done, and thank you Anita.
It was good for what it was, but it wasn't what I was expecting!
I watched with interest the video. I was surprised to have a sales pitch at the end. I wish she had spoken more about her family in transition with adding her first child into the relationships.
I liked it so much I bought the series!
Beautiful story.
CONVICTING!!!
Letters to an Unknown Daughter turned out to be just a teaser to get a foot in the door for a church service.

Anita shares a captivating and touching story of the painful and selfless side of obedience to God for a greater good. She uses her experience, strength, and hope to lead you to an increased zeal for the letters written to you by God.
Nicely done!

God is so good if we trust Him. That must have been a long journey for Anita and I wept because I too was a young mother. Trusting God has not always been easy but today my son serves God. Praise the Lord. Thank you, Anita, for sharing this story with us. What a wonderful testimony.
Very good it shows the pain that a person in her situation goes through...  The guilt, pain and shame.... she talked about the one who forgave her and got her through...

Pleasantly suprised by the content of this movie, testamony and not drama. God used it to speak to my heart in a very real way about knowing Him and being excited to know Him. So thankful for her ministry and Amazon for having so many encouraging and educational movies about spiritual growth and history of the church.
Uplifting and encouraging!
Wasn't actually a movie like we thought but it was excellent.
This book was for my wife and she loves it.  She is planning on using it for a women's Bible study group.
Amazing testimony! Loved it!

I thought this was going to be a movie. Instead, it's Anita Keagy speaking to a small group about her daughter she put up for adoption as a teenager. It's a very biblical discussion. Should have been under documentary.
I thought I was going to watch this as an adoption story but it was more of just a great testimony with a message for every Christian. Very inspiring!

This is a short (about 39+minutes) but heart-touching testimony of a woman who made an unusual mistake at end of high school and planning a move and starting college.  You cannot help but feel her emotions many years later during the talk.
Good movie
Brave, Honest, Inspirational! Very glad I watched it all the way until the end. What a well thought out story with a great example of " Love Letters!"
Good

I was impressed with the sincerity and the "letters" comparison. And yes,I want to know my Lords thoughts.
Well done Anita!
Every girl should watch this heartfelt testimony of giving up a child and being reunited. Amazing how God works in peoples lives.
excellent very helpful
inspirational film, really enjoyed it
I thought it was a movie. It was a speech.

This has surprised some viewers, as it is not a drama but a true story related in the first person.  The message is delivered to an audience with sincerity and is well-reasoned.  This could make a good discussion starter between parents and their teens on dating and the effects of unintended pregnancy.
Very inspiring. It encourages every true Christian yo know Him and make Him known.
Great
Educatioal
It was a great teaching video

This is an extremely moving program that is worth watching. The story is touching and Anita's willingness to be so open is refreshing. The miracles in her life testify to a God who does the impossible on behalf of His children...and the lessons that all can learn from this are invaluable.
Very inspiring! Blessed to hear the authenticity. On a side note, I was pleasantly surprised when going to her website to find a photo of her and her daughter. Twila is an old friend of my mom's! :)
Excellent!
What a great story! This was just the encouragement I needed this evening. Thank you Amazon for including this in your listings.
Loved it
not interesting

It is always the female that bears the "shame" of an error in judgment.  Males need to feel ashamed of themselves for their own lack of restraint and society needs to quit putting so much on the females and hunt down the males and make them share in the responsibility that comes with bad decisions.
Definitely worth the watch!!!!  It blesses me and my husband greatly!!
Very moving. I could relate to her story

Wow, a very encouraging, challenging movie full of practical theology in hard circumstances, from the first-person perspective.  Bad choices impact way more people than we realize when we make them.  If you are a true believer you will love this short film.  :^)
